channel.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bard
channel.description:
**Faction:** _Neutral_
**Class Type:** _Investigative_
**Passives:** **Looting**: If a player with a piece of the Grand Finale dies at night, you will take it. **Hypnotic Voice:** Night immune once. You will keep this passive when your class changes.
**Day abilities:**
**The Grand Finale!** (infinite uses): Show them your true self! (can only be used if you have all 2 pieces, 4 pieces are in the game, but you only require 2 to transform)
**Night abilities**: **Where is it?!** (infinite uses): Check a player, if they have a piece of the Grand Finale, you will bypass their occ immunity and occupy time for the night and take it. (if they don't hae a piece, you won't do anything, but you will visit them) **Last Dance** (infinite uses): Attack a player and take their piece of the Grand Finale (you will not attack them if the don't have, but you will visit them).
_Showing your true self means that you choose between 3 forms:_
The Bard?: Win condition: Survive. (this would replace alch's Win Condition if they change the Alchemist)
**Night abilities:** Sing and dance! (3 uses): Prevent everyone visting you tonight.
The Musician: Win condition: Kill a non-Blue Dragon player.
**Passives:** **Perfect:** Occupy and redirection immune.
**Day Abilities:** **Follow my voice:** Make a player say something and force them to vote another player, they won't be notified about any of this. **Night Abilities:** **Crescendo!** (2 uses): The chosen player will target themselves. (The Prince, The Drunk and The Court Wizard will get occupyed instead.) **Hypnotised** (1 use): This player will vote up another player from their own faction. If the targeted player gets reaped, you won't lose an use, but they won't vote anyone up. Neutrals will vote up someone randomly.
The Maestro: Win Condition: Save a non-Blue Dragon player from getting executed or from getting attacked.
**Passives:** **His Favourite Musician:** The Prince won't be able to execute you for one time when he tries to. **Oops:** The court will get notified, that there's a Maestro amoungst them.
**Day Abilities: The Great Story** (1 use): Every Blue Dragon member will not be able to use their day abilities, except The Prince.
**Night Abilities: Your friend**(infinite uses): Determine if a player is the Neutral Killer or an Unseen member or a Cult member. Prevent any attack targeting them, if the Prince tries to execute them, you will get killed instead.
Thanks to **Geyde** for the help.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bard
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
Maestro

Maestro is the Evil transition class from the Bard, and as such helps evils with their win condition.

markneu:

The Maestro: Win Condition: Save a non-Blue Dragon player from getting executed or from getting attacked.

This win condition is fairly easy to achieve, but befitting of an evil support class.

Changes

markneu:

His Favourite Musician: The Prince won’t be able to execute you for one time when he tries to. Oops: The court will get notified, that there’s a Maestro amoungst them.

Remove this passive. If you were to be executed by the prince, you would immediately die the next day. Pointless

markneu:

The Great Story (1 use): Every Blue Dragon member will not be able to use their day abilities, except The Prince.

I just wanted to comment on this. I couldn’t find out anything broken you could do with it.

This class seems almost entirely balanced, and doesn’t appear to need any further changes.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bard
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
Well, I’m back again.

The different classes that the bard can change into, as previously confirmed, have a relationship of BD-sided, Neutral, and Evil-sided.

Maintaining these alignments while also reasonably making all options applicable is one of the intentions of this post.

Minstrel

The minstrel is the Neutral transition class from the Bard, and as such follows a Neutral goal.

markneu:

Win condition: Survive. (this would replace alch’s Win Condition if they change the Alchemist)

Since this is their new wincon, it is important to give them ways to defend themselves against both attacks AND poison/bleed affects.

Changes

markneu:

Night abilities: Sing and dance! (3 uses): Prevent everyone visting you tonight.

Reduce the uses of this ability to 2 to be better in line with stoneskin from alch. A class should be able to defend themselves, but not unreasonably so.

Earlier, I referred to the necessity of having a way for true neutrals to save themselves from poison / bleed effects (although the recent change to alchemist contradicts this). So, I advise the addition of a day ability to help this.

Reinvigorating Tune (Day) - All who visit you this night will be healed. You will be cured of poison/bleed if anyone visits you. (Single Use)

In this manner, the ability prevents the Minstrel from being entirely self-sufficient, but gives them a method of saving themselves from poison/bleed. Notably, this ability is a sacrificial one in a sorc game, considering it saves everyone but yourself from the bomb.

Also, a quick last minute change. Changing this to a social class to better line up with what it can do.

Final

Minstrel
Neutral Social

Reinvigorating Tune (Day) - All who visit you this night will be healed. You will be cured of poison/bleed if anyone visits you. (Single Use)

Sing and dance! (Night) - Prevent everyone visting you tonight (2 Uses)

Your objective is to Survive until the end of the game.

Musician

The Musician is the BD aligned transformation for the Bard.

markneu:

Win condition: Kill a non-Blue Dragon player.

It is almost entirely impossible to win with this class in the event of it being a cult game, as cult kills relatively rarely. Thus, it is being changed to make it a more compelling choice in those games.

Changes

Your objective is to live to see 3 Non-BD players die.

This change to the win condition keeps it a viable option no matter if it is cult/unseen.

Change class type to Offensive

The abilities of the Musician are almost entirely focused on redirection.

Removal of Hypnotised

Auto-outing evils is very unfun to play against. Also consider the possibility of finding mm before n3 with this.

Final

Musician

Perfect (Passive) - Immune to most occupation and redirection abilities.

Follow my Voice (Day) - Make a player say something and force them to vote another player. They won’t be notified about this. (2 Uses)

Crescendo! (Night) - Player will target themselves tonight (Infinite Uses)

Your objective is to live to see 3 non-BD players die

item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
You are referring to how that would work, correct?

Assuming you are:

  • Day ‘Grand Finale’ is selected, and much like Alch’s concoct potion, it opens up a list of 3 different classes
  • The selected class becomes your new class at the beginning of the night.

As for the other classes (if you were referring to that), they need a major overhaul. Currently, the classes have a certain relationship:

The Bard? (you should make this the minstrel) is a true neutral class
The Musician is BD sided
Maestro is evil sided

In design, focusing on blurring the lines should have importance.

item.title: [Class Suggestion] The Bard
item.dc:creator: Geyde
item.description:
This is going to be an extremely long post, so buckle in.

Bard : Class Identity

This class attempts to collect pieces of a composition to ascertain their true purpose. They will attempt to gain these through any means necessary.

  • Should be able to kill/check to gain these pieces.
  • Should NOT have any abilities that do not contribute to this purpose.

In addition, upon further inspection, this class bears MANY similarities to Inquisitor. In order to keep the classes’ identity distinct, all changes proposed will be in the direction of moving it away from inq.

Tidying Up

  • Necessary for easier reading and functionality. Baseline.
markneu:

The one and the only: Unique.
I have a free will : Conversion Immune.

As already mentioned in this thread, these two passives are unnecessary. Neutral classes are already immune to conversion, and a class being unique should be marked with or .

Given that the removal of these two would free up a spot, check the solving issues section for a proposed addition to their passives.

Additions / Removals

markneu:

Writing: Occupy and redirection immune.

Remove. Preserve this as a potential claim for evils while also freeing up space for other passives.

markneu:

Looting (infinite uses): Take a dead player’s piece of the Grand Finale (if they had one).

Remove. Makes space for the Looting Passive (see later)

markneu:

A great song (2 uses): The chosen player will not be able to use their day abilities or prevents them if they already used them.

Remove. Doesn’t fit with class identity. This class is about gaining all the pieces to then transition.

Alert (Passive): Night immune once. You will keep this passive when your class changes.

Addition. Almost necessary in order to get the pieces.

Looting (Passive): If a player with a piece of the Grand Finale dies at night, you will take it.

Addition. Buff the class to be more efficient.

Solving Issues

  • Unspecified amount of pieces needed for Grand Finale.

How to fix: Set it to a value. Personally, I’d advise 2 being the amount required to change classes, with 3/4 in game in total as to not make this another Inquisitor.

  • How would the UI work when you have all the pieces?

How to fix: Make ‘the Grand Finale’ a day ability.

You will receive replies for the classes that the bard will turn into at around 6PM PST 10/14.
